name: IOUserAudioClockDevice
desc: An audio clock device object, used to synchronize and perform I/O.

items.name: + Create
items.desc: Allocates and initializes an instance of the audio clock device class.

items.name: - init
items.desc: Initializes an instance of the audio clock device class.

items.name: - free
items.desc: Frees the clock device.

items.name: - GetClassID
items.desc: Gets the audio class identifier of the object.

items.name: - GetBaseClassID
items.desc: Gets the audio class identifier of the base class object.

items.name: - StartIO
items.desc: Tells the clock device to start I/O.

items.name: - StopIO
items.desc: Tells the clock device to stop I/O.

items.name: - PerformDeviceConfigurationChange
items.desc: Tells the clock device to handle a configuration change.

items.name: - AbortDeviceConfigurationChange
items.desc: Tells the clock device to stop handling a configuration change.

items.name: - HandleChangeSampleRate
items.desc: Tells the clock device the sample rate is changing.

items.name: - GetUID
items.desc: Gets the unique identifier of the clock device.

items.name: - SetClockDomain
items.desc: Sets the clock domain value of the clock device.

items.name: - GetClockDomain
items.desc: Gets the clock domain value of the clock device.

items.name: - SetSampleRate
items.desc: Sets the sample rate for the clock device.

items.name: - GetSampleRate
items.desc: Gets the sample rate of the clock device.

items.name: - SetAvailableSampleRates
items.desc: Sets the available sample rates for the clock device.

items.name: - GetAvailableSampleRates
items.desc: Gets the available sample rates of the clock device.

items.name: - GetNumberAvailableSampleRates
items.desc: Gets the number of available sample rates of the clock device.

items.name: - GetSupportsPrewarming
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates clock device’s support for prewarming.

items.name: - SetZeroTimeStampPeriod
items.desc: Sets the zero time stamp of the clock device.

items.name: - GetZeroTimestampPeriod
items.desc: Gets the zero time stamp of the clock device.

items.name: - SetOutputLatency
items.desc: Sets the output latency of the clock device.

items.name: - GetOutputLatency
items.desc: Gets the output latency of the clock device.

items.name: - SetInputLatency
items.desc: Sets the input latency of the clock device.

items.name: - GetInputLatency
items.desc: Get the input latency of the clock device.

items.name: - GetDeviceIsRunning
items.desc: Gets a Boolean value that indicates whether the device is running.

items.name: - SetDeviceIsAlive
items.desc: Sets a Boolean value to represent whether the device is alive.

items.name: - GetDeviceIsAlive
items.desc: Gets a Boolean value that represents whether the device is alive.

items.name: - SetIsHidden
items.desc: Sets a Boolean value to indicate whether the device is hidden.

items.name: - GetIsHidden
items.desc: Gets a Boolean value that indicates whether the device is hidden.

items.name: - SetClockAlgorithm
items.desc: Sets the clock algorithm of the clock device.

items.name: - GetClockAlgorithm
items.desc: Gets the clock algorithm of the clock device.

items.name: - SetClockIsStable
items.desc: Sets a Boolean value to represent the clock’s stability.

items.name: - GetClockIsStable
items.desc: Gets a Boolean value that represents the clock’s stability.

items.name: - SetTransportType
items.desc: Sets the transport type of the clock device.

items.name: - GetTransportType
items.desc: Gets the transport type of the clock device.

items.name: - RequestDeviceConfigurationChange
items.desc: Instructs the host to initiate a configuration change operation.

items.name: - AddControl
items.desc: Adds a control to the clock device.

items.name: - RemoveControl
items.desc: Removes a control from the clock device.

items.name: - UpdateCurrentZeroTimestamp
items.desc: Updates the current timestamp value.

items.name: - GetCurrentZeroTimestamp
items.desc: Gets the current zero timestamp value.

items.name: - GetCurrentClientSampleTime
items.desc: Gets the current sample time in the ring buffer that the client has written to or read from.
